t: John 12
Mary Anoints Jesus
Jesus,*p therefore, six days before the Passover, came to Bethany where Lazarus was, whom Jesus had raised from the dead.
So they made Him a supper there, and Martha was serving; but Lazarus was one of those reclining at*i the*i table*i with Him.
Mary then took a pound of very costly perfume of pure nard, and anointed the feet of Jesus and wiped His feet with her hair; and the house was filled with the fragrance of the perfume.
But Judas Iscariot, one of His disciples, who was intending to betray Him, said,
“Why was this perfume not sold for three hundred denarii and given to poor people?”*i
Now he said this, not because he was concerned about the poor, but because he was a thief, and as he had the money box, he used to pilfer what was put into it.
Therefore Jesus said, “Let*r her*r alone,*r so*r that*r she*r may*r keep*r it*r for*r the*r day*r of*r My*r burial.*r
For*r you*r always*r have*r the*r poor*r with*r you,*r but*r you*r do*r not*r always*r have*r Me.”*r
The*p large crowd of the Jews then learned that He was there; and they came, not for Jesus’ sake only, but that they might also see Lazarus, whom He raised from the dead.
But the chief priests planned to put Lazarus to death also;
because on account of him many of the Jews were going away and were believing in Jesus.
Jesus Enters Jerusalem
On*p the next day the large crowd who had come to the feast, when they heard that Jesus was coming to Jerusalem,
took the branches of the palm trees and went out to meet Him, and began*i to shout, “Hosanna! Blessed*s is*s He*s who*s comes*s in*s the*s name*s of*s the*s Lord,*s even the King of Israel.”
Jesus, finding a young donkey, sat on it; as it is written,
“Fear*s not,*s daughter*s of*s Zion*s ;behold,*s your*s King*s is*s coming,*s seated*s on*s a*s donkey’s*s colt.”*s
These things His disciples did not understand at the first; but when Jesus was glorified, then they remembered that these things were written of Him, and that they had done these things to Him.
So the people, who were with Him when He called Lazarus out of the tomb and raised him from the dead, continued to testify about*i Him.*i
For this reason also the people went and met Him, because they heard that He had performed this sign.
So the Pharisees said to one another, “You see that you are not doing any good; look, the world has gone after Him.”
Greeks Seek Jesus
Now*p there were some Greeks among those who were going up to worship at the feast;
these then came to Philip, who was from Bethsaida of Galilee, and began*i to*i ask him, saying, “Sir, we wish to see Jesus.”
Philip came and told Andrew; Andrew and Philip came and told Jesus.
And Jesus answered them, saying, “The*r hour*r has*r come*r for*r the*r Son*r of*r Man*r to*r be*r glorified.*r
Truly,*r truly,*r I*r say*r to*r you,*r unless*r a*r grain*r of*r wheat*r falls*r into*r the*r earth*r and*r dies,*r it*r remains*r alone;*r but*r if*r it*r dies,*r it*r bears*r much*r fruit.*r
He*r who*r loves*r his*r life*r loses*r it,*r and*r he*r who*r hates*r his*r life*r in*r this*r world*r will*r keep*r it*r to*r life*r eternal.*r
If*r anyone*r serves*r Me,*r he*r must*r follow*r Me;*r and*r where*r I*r am,*r there*r My*r servant*r will*r be*r also;*r if*r anyone*r serves*r Me,*r the*r Father*r will*r honor*r him.*r
Jesus Foretells His Death
“Now*rp My*r soul*r has*r become*r troubled;*r and*r what*r shall*r I*r say,*r ‘Father,*r save*r Me*r from*r this*r hour’?*r But*r for*r this*r purpose*r I*r came*r to*r this*r hour.*r
Father,*r glorify*r Your*r name.”*r Then a voice came out of heaven: “I have both glorified it, and will glorify it again.”
So the crowd of*i people*i who stood by and heard it were saying that it had thundered; others were saying, “An angel has spoken to Him.”
Jesus answered and said, “This*r voice*r has*r not*r come*r for*r My*r sake,*r but*r for*r your*r sakes.*r
Now*r judgment*r is*r upon*r this*r world;*r now*r the*r ruler*r of*r this*r world*r will*r be*r cast*r out.*r
And*r I,*r if*r I*r am*r lifted*r up*r from*r the*r earth,*r will*r draw*r all*r men*r to*r Myself.”*r
But He was saying this to indicate the kind of death by which He was to die.
The crowd then answered Him, “We have heard out of the Law that the Christ is to remain forever; and how can You say, ‘The*r Son*r of*r Man*r must*r be*r lifted*r up’?*r Who is this Son of Man?”

So Jesus said to them, “For*r a*r little*r while*r longer*r the*r Light*r is*r among*r you.*r Walk*r while*r you*r have*r the*r Light,*r so*r that*r darkness*r will*r not*r overtake*r you;*r he*r who*r walks*r in*r the*r darkness*r does*r not*r know*r where*r he*r goes.*r
While*r you*r have*r the*r Light,*r believe*r in*r the*r Light,*r so*r that*r you*r may*r become*r sons*r of*r Light.”*r These*bp things Jesus spoke, and He went away and hid Himself from them.
But though He had performed so many signs before them, yet*i they were not believing in Him.
This*i was*i to fulfill the word of Isaiah the prophet which he spoke: “Lord,*s who*s has*s believed*s our*s report?*s And to*s whom*s has*s the*s arm*s of*s the*s Lord*s been*s revealed?”*s
For this reason they could not believe, for Isaiah said again,

“He*s has*s blinded*s their*s eyes*s and*s He*s hardened*s their*s heart,*s so*s that*s they*s would*s not*s see*s with*s their*s eyes*s and*s perceive*s with*s their*s heart,*s and*s be*s converted*s and*s I heal*s them.”*s
These things Isaiah said because he saw His glory, and he spoke of Him.
Nevertheless many even of the rulers believed in Him, but because of the Pharisees they were not confessing Him,*i for fear that they would be put out of the synagogue;
for they loved the approval of men rather than the approval of God.
And*p Jesus cried out and said, “He*r who*r believes*r in*r Me,*r does*r not*r believe*r in*r Me*r but*r in*r Him*r who*r sent*r Me.*r
He*r who*r sees*r Me*r sees*r the*r One*r who*r sent*r Me.*r
I*r have*r come*r as*ir Light*r into*r the*r world,*r so*r that*r everyone*r who*r believes*r in*r Me*r will*r not*r remain*r in*r darkness.*r
If*r anyone*r hears*r My*r sayings*r and*r does*r not*r keep*r them,*r I*r do*r not*r judge*r him;*r for*r I*r did*r not*r come*r to*r judge*r the*r world,*r but*r to*r save*r the*r world.*r
He*r who*r rejects*r Me*r and*r does*r not*r receive*r My*r sayings,*r has*r one*r who*r judges*r him;*r the*r word*r I*r spoke*r is*r what*r will*r judge*r him*r at*r the*r last*r day.*r

For*r I*r did*r not*r speak*r on*r My*r own*r initiative,*r but*r the*r Father*r Himself*r who*r sent*r Me*r has*r given*r Me*r a*r commandment*r as*ir to*ir what*r to*r say*r and*r what*r to*r speak.*r
I*r know*r that*r His*r commandment*r is*r eternal*r life;*r therefore*r the*r things*r I*r speak,*r I*r speak*r just*r as*r the*r Father*r has*r told*r Me.”*r
